name: The Block
title: Bitcoin And Ether Prices Slide Amid Macro Fears
text:
Synopsis
Cryptocurrency markets are experiencing significant volatility due to macroeconomic concerns about sustained inflation, with bitcoin and ether prices dropping sharply amid broader market uncertainties.

Key Insights
- Bitcoin dropped approximately 8% to below $95,000, while ether fell 12% to under $3,300
- Macro fears driven by ISM data showing faster-than-expected U.S. economic growth have heightened inflation concerns
- 10-year Treasury yields reached their highest level since April, indicating market stress
- Upcoming economic events (FOMC meeting minutes, CPI data, non-farm payrolls) are expected to influence market sentiment
- South Korea plans to gradually lift its institutional crypto trading ban, potentially opening new market opportunities
- Movement Labs is closing in on a $100 million Series B funding round, valuing the company at $3 billion
- Canaan introduced a Bitcoin miner that doubles as a home heater, potentially creating a novel approach to mining accessibility
